conclusion: The force exerted by the adult is 100 N at an angle of 37 degrees above the horizontal.
The vertical component of the force (Fy) is calculated as Fy = F * sin(37 degrees) = 100 * 0.6 = 60 N.
The combined mass of the child and sled is m = 30 kg + 10 kg = 40 kg.
The weight (W) is calculated as W = m * g = 40 * 10 = 400 N.
The normal force (N) is calculated as N = W - Fy = 400 - 60 = 340 N.
The magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is equal to the normal force, which is 340 N.
